intro: Poiretia latifolia var. unifoliolata, commonly known as the broad-leafed poiretia, is a rare and distinctive plant species characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. The plant exhibits a unique morphology with its single, elongated leaflets that give it a striking appearance. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its natural habitat.
